context_bundle.summary: Security Logging and Monitoring Failures (OWASP A09:2021): Inability to detect, escalate, or respond to breaches. Average breach detection: 194 days. Fix: log all auth events, log access failures, use structured JSON logging, integrate with SIEM (Splunk/ELK), implement real-time alerting, use immutable audit trails.

onboarding.quick_start: Security logging: 1) Log all auth success/failures with IP/user agent, 2) Log authorization failures (who tried to access what), 3) Use structured JSON format, 4) Integrate with SIEM for correlation, 5) Alert on anomalies (5+ failed logins = brute force alert).
common_patterns: Structured log: {timestamp, event_type, user_id, ip_address, outcome, details}
SIEM integration: Send logs via syslog or HTTP Event Collector
Anomaly detection: Alert if login failures > 5 in 5 minutes from same IP
Immutable logs: Write-once storage (WORM) with hash chain verification

known_errors.cause: No monitoring of authentication failures, no alerting
known_errors.solution: Implement real-time alerting on auth failures, privilege changes
known_errors.prevention: SIEM integration with correlation rules, 24/7 SOC monitoring

known_errors.error: Logs tampered by attacker to cover tracks
known_errors.cause: Logs stored on same compromised server, mutable storage
known_errors.solution: Use separate log server, implement WORM storage
known_errors.prevention: Centralized logging to immutable storage, hash chain integrity
